newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - May 2.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - May 2.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Friday's Daily Variety:
* News Corp ASkyB chairman Preston Padden, one of Rupert Murdoch's top lieutenants, resigned on Thursday.

* Walt Disney unit ABC's coming out of the closet episode of "Ellen" did better than most optimistic projections, posting a 23.4 rating and 35 share in households and winning big in key demographics, according to Nielsen.
* Viacom shares rose on Thursday on unfounded speculation that Metro-Goldwyn Mayer's half-owner, Kirk Kerkorian, was buying its stock.
* The Senate Commerce Committee voted 19 to one in favor of a ban on violent television during times when children are most likely to be in the viewing audience.
* Stephen Herek, who just renewed his three-film directing pact with Disney, plans to direct "Holy Man," starring Eddie Murphy, for Caravan Pictures, sources said Thursday.
* Jerry Bruckheimer, who has produced The Rock, Dangerous Minds and Crimson Tide, has signed another five-year agreement with Walt Disney Co.
